etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in George Bentham (1800–1884), botanist. From verbena + -aceous, after scientific Latin Verbenaceae, family name

definitions: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the family Verbenaceae, comprising herbaceous plants, shrubs, and a few trees and lianes, native mainly to warm regions of the Americas and Asia.

notes.text: These plants are often aromatic and typically have simple leaves and racemes, cymes, or heads of tubular (salverform) flowers.
